title: Broken text, every character in one space
content: The letters in a text window are all compressed in one space, resulting in terribly broken text. Tried the text settings and the troubleshoot mode and the problem persists. Using the zoom function (ctrl + middle mouse button) alleviates the problem but there's still broken text. Pictured is Wikipedia exhibiting this problem.
creator: ShockwaveOne

title: Problem with audio and video on the platform that I use for my work on OSx after the upgrade to Sequoia 15.0
content: I am using 15.0 Firefox version that was very reliable up until this upgrade. I am allowing all the permissions for Audio and the Camera. Audio started to work after several attempts to make it work but the video freezes after a few minutes being connected to the client. The permissions are still active but for some reason video crashes few minutes into the call with the audio, as well. Can you please look into the possible issue? As I mentioned it was working seamlessly up until the upgrade and installing a newer version of Firefox did not help, it was actually worse and the sound was crackling and breaking up. I am sticking then with version 115 that was installed on my computer for a long time and I do the updates whenever prompted so my version 115 is up to date. Is it possible that Firefox needs to the update after the upgrade for OSx just lie the applications have to do whenever is the update/upgrade to the OSx and Windows OS. Thank you so much.
creator: cmfxnwmvbj

title: Browser History
content:
I was using the "new" version in Troubleshoot mode. When I finished, I went to delete my History (once I found it) and told it to delete the current History. IT DELETED ALL MY HISTORY AND I HAD PAGES I NEEDED IN THE LIST. How do I get back my History???

And using this is aggravating because Mozilla doesn't know what is wrong to Fix It!
creator: anewdawn42

title: web page blocked
content: I'm attempting to find a driver for my RadioShack Dazzle SD card reader. I went to techrepublic.com who claimed to have a driver that would meet my need. But the web page was blank - I believe I was blocked from techrepublic. Why. Or if I am not being intentionally blocked how may I connect to techrepublic so that I can download a driver. Please let me know how I may do so. Thank you for your help
creator: joekopnit

title: macOS Firefox won't load websites, but can access local IP addresses
content:
Today, Firefox on macOS, and Firefox in a Parallels VM (Windows 10) are unable to open any websites outside my local network(e.g. 192.168.1.1). Other browsers are work correctly, and even "curl" works correctly. Checked all settings, reinstalled Firefox, refreshed Firefox, re-read all Mozilla docs on this issue. Doesn't appear to be affected by Firefox setting "DNS prefetch". Mac is running Sequioa 15.0 Firefox versions: macOS 130.0.1 (64-bit), Windows 10 (within Parallels for Mac): 125.0.3 (64-bit) Firewall is set to prevent incoming connections to Firefox and Google Chrome (set by company profile).

Thanks in advance for any insight.

content:
Unable to install the FIREFOX version of the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on (aka extension)

Steps to Reproduce: Open Firefox (I'm on the latest Windows 10 version: 130.0.1 (64-bit)) Access the Developed-by-Google add-on here: https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout Click blue "Get....." button On the Terms and Conditions page click Accept and Install Firefox downloads an .xpi file and browser displays steps on how to install the add-on Follow the steps, and attempt to install it but receive error message

See screenshot'

Troubleshooting Steps Followed these steps to no avail: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/unable-install-add-ons-extensions-or-themes#w_corrupt-extension-files

Anyone know what the issue could be?

title: Does the pop-up blocker also prevent execution of code?
content:
I received a suspicious e-mail with an .eml file attached today. It tried posing as a pdf file, so I'm guessing it was malicious. While deleting the e-mail, I sadly clicked on it by accident. Luckily, I think, Firefox blocked the pop-up that resulted.

I was wondering if the pop-up blocker in Firefox would have prevented any malicious code from running. Does the blocker prevent anything from actually being executed or loaded? For what it's worth, I did a MalwareBytes scan that came back clean, but I've changed my most important passwords just to be safe.

title: Lost all my tabs after a force restart, this has never happened before
content:
Had to restart my computer because it froze, but when i open firefox all my tabs are suddenly gone, this has never happened before and i do force restart my pc plenty of times.

the "restore previous session" button doesnt even show up in my menu; my about:profile page doesnt show or open my previous activity; and all my files in the sessionstore-backups folder are way too small and recent to be holding my old tabs ( i had over 300 open)

What can i do?

title: Hi I've just noticed today that at the top of the settings page in Firefox it says 'Your browser is being managed by your organisation'. What is this and how to I get rid of it. It say that its 'Active'
content:
Hi Ive just noticed today that at the top of the settings Firefox page it say 'Your browser is being managed by your organisation'. It say that its 'Active' when I click on the link it states the following

Active Policy Name Policy Value Certificates ImportEnterpriseRoots true

And when i click on documentation there is a very long list of topics under the heading Documentation Policy Name

Can someone please help? firstly what is this ? What is it doing on my laptop? I have never noticed it before. Is it spyware - is it dangerous do i need to get rid of it? Ive attached a screenshot

Thank you for your help its much appreciated.
creator: ki

title: Autonumbering downloads with the same name
content:
I've found plenty of past forum posts about this issue but nothing recent and maybe it is a bug but I'm doubting it. I want Firefox to auto number downloads of the same name, instead of asking to replace the file that already exists. Example: XYZ.jpg is in the downloads folder downloading another will default to XYZ(1).jpg, just like every chromium based browser does natively.

The setting "Always ask you where to save files" IS DISABLED, and I'm still experiencing every download of the same name needing to manually enter a number or change the file name somehow because it just asks to replace or not. I have Revo nuked Firefox from the system to reinstall, created new profiles since for some reason factory reset isn't a feature anymore. I have tried Firefox on multiple systems all with the same issue. I even tried enabling always ask where to save files in case something got switched.

If I'm missing something stupid, "great?" I want this convenience resolved but at the same time it shouldn't be this difficult to fix, it should just naturally be right there as an easy fix. I really want to see Firefox succeed have more competition for chrome based browsers, but its always something stupid like this that inevitably pushes me back to chrome.

Thank you for any help.
creator: gunnison.jachin

For example, right clicking on an image will bring up "Save As..." as an option, but when I choose that, nothing happens. No prompt to save, nor does the file appear anywhere.

When I choose "Save" as a pulldown on cloud XLSX files...similarly, nothing happens.

When I download something, Firefox is supposed to open up a prompt asking me where I want to save the file but that never opens...nor does the file download.

I am totally baffled.

title: Multiple Account Containers (MAC) and _path_ separation, eg github
content:
Is it possible to use MAC to auto-separate tabs into containers based on the _path_ of a URL? For example, with github I might want github.com/foo, github.com/bar, and github.com/baz to be associated with a different login to all my other github access (eg a work account rather than a personal one).

I know I can "reopen tab in container" but having a path auto-open in a container will prevent silly mistakes like commenting on an issue with the wrong user.

Essentially the "always open this site" option but extended to path, not just domain.

Or should I post this as an enhancement request to https://github.com/mozilla/multi-account-containers/ ?
creator: sweh

content: I have used Fire fox for years and have never had a problem. title: Where is Yaho lurking?
content:
For many years I use FireFox as my preferred browser

Recently I find that Yahoo is somehow taking over.

I keep removing it from settings with the guidance of

support.mozilla.org › en-US › questionsHow to get rid of Yahoo search engine? | Firefox Support ... May 11, 2017 · Hi, open the Add-ons Manager (Ctrl+Shift+A) > Extensions/Plugins, and disable/remove anything 'Yahoo' that shouldn't be there. You can also check your Firefox Desktop

and still it persists and yahoo comes up as my search engine

Where is that "Firefox Desktop"?

When I click on Firefox beneath the search window are icons for Amazonm Vodafone, Hotels.com, support.mozila, YouTYube and Google - BUT NO YAHOO !!!! I do not rteally want any of those either but at least they do not impose themselves on my browser

title: Unable to sign in to google Account
content:
I have been unable to sign in to google accounts on 3rd party websites for a while now. I'm using firefox develloper edition. i do not have this issue with normal firefox

every time i try to sign in i get redirected to https://support.google.com/accounts/a.../32050?hl=en

Heres some of the things i tried:

  • Clear cache and cookies
  • "repair" Firefox from the uninstaller
  • Reinstall Firefox

To be honest it is quite a bit annoying and i cannot find a solution thanks in advance for any help

title: SOMEONE is CONTROLING MY FIREFOX WITHOUT MY PERMISSION!
content:
Information Your browser is being managed by your organization.

I am 75 years old. I am RETIRED there is NO REASON for an organization to be in CONTROL of ANYTHING on my computer. How do I STOP THIS?

I don't know if this is related or not, but Something is BLOCKING my ability to use check boxes or circles. Sometimes I can see the box but my response is NOT VISIBLE. Tonight I was trying to complete a survey and the questions were visible but I was COMPLETELY UNABLE to see the answer boxes/circles. Sometimes they would be briefly visible when the page initially opened but QUICKLY DISAPPEARED and were NOT identifiable by manipulating my cursor using mouse, space bar, or tab bar.

I have stayed with Firefox as my default browser for several DECADES and PREFER NOT to change now. BUT this MUST STOP!
creator: palladinrn1

title: I sign into sync, but my browser doesn't sync ....
content:
This is really frustrating. So I have been using ff sync for 20 years and have never seen anything like this. I sign into ff sync and it appears to work, but then my browser does not actually start syncing. I try again and again. Same thing. I even tried to sign in on my android phone. Same thing! It signs in to accounts.firefox.com just fine. Otherwise I 'd not be able to be logged into this forum... But my browser is not signing into sync.

What the heck is going on?

title: Performans Yavaşlığı
content:
Merhaba,

Mozilla Firefox tarayıcısını kullanırken aşırı yavaş çalıştığını fark ettim. Sayfaların yüklenmesi uzun sürüyor ve bazı özellikler beklenenden daha yavaş yanıt veriyor. Tarayıcıyı güncelledim ve önbelleği temizledim, ancak sorun devam ediyor. Bu konuda yardımcı olmanızı rica ediyorum.

yaklaşık son 1 - 1.5 aydır bu sorunu yaşıyorum daha öncesinde bu sorun mevcut değildi.

Teşekkürler.
creator: muzaffertopalbekiroglu
